Course Description: Data mining aims at finding the useful patterns in large data sets. Interest in the field is motivated by the growth of computerized data collection due to ubiquity of Internet enabled devices. This course will cover a set of techniques designed to be used for finding interesting patterns from the data. The techniques include classification, clustering, association rule mining and sequence mining. Students will learn and use the open source R statistical software, see http://www.r-project.org, and machine learning packages such as Weka in this course.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Students are able to discuss basic applications, concepts and techniques of data mining such as association rules mining, classification, clustering and sequence mining.
Course Outcomes.CO2: Students are able to use data mining software (Weka, R etc.) to solve practical problems related to association rules mining, classification, clustering and sequence mining.
Course Outcomes.CO3: Students are able to analyze the performance of different data mining techniques.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Exploratory data analysis on numeric and categorical attributes, frequent pattern mining (introduction), partitional clustering (K-Means, EM), Classification (Decision Trees)
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: One programming assignment to introduce the students to basics of pre-processing and analyzing a small dataset using R. One assignment containing practice questions on frequent pattern mining .

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Exploratory data analysis on high dimensional data, PCA, SVD, LDA, Frequent pattern mining (Itemset summaries), sequence pattern mining
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: A programming assignment to apply PCA/SVD techniques on real dataset.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Probabilistic classification, support vector machines, kernel svm, classifier evaluation
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: A programming assignment to apply different classifiers as well as evaluate their performance.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Hierarchical/Density based clustering, Spectral clustering, Graph Mining
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: A programming assignment on hierarchical/density based clustering.

Weekly Lab Plan.Laboratory Exercise: Data Preprocessing and Analysis using R
